alert.note: Alert for Grant; Hot Spring; Lonoke; Pulaski; Saline (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 09 at 7:00AM CST until January 09 at 10:00AM CST by NWS Little Rock
info.description: The National Weather Service in Little Rock has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northern Grant County in central Arkansas... Southwestern Lonoke County in central Arkansas... Southeastern Pulaski County in central Arkansas... Southeastern Saline County in central Arkansas... Hot Spring County in southwestern Arkansas... * Until 1000 AM CST. * At 700 AM CST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional heavy rainfall is expected. As a result...flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Little Rock, North Little Rock, Benton, Sherwood, West Little Rock, Maumelle, Bryant, Malvern, Downtown Little Rock, Lonoke, Southwest Little Rock, Haskell, Shannon Hills, Wrightsville, Argenta, Rockport, Traskwood, Tull, Prattsville and Poyen. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: Grant; Hot Spring; Lonoke; Pulaski; Saline
